vectorData.altText: 4. Which functional subdivision of the nervous system supplies parietal peritoneum with sensory fibres?
The somatic nervous system supplies all tissues of the body wall, including its deepest layer, the parietal peritoneum.
is supplied with sensory fibres by the somatic sensory nerves of the body wall. Pain with irritation of the parietal peritoneum is therefore somatic in nature; it is sharp and well-localized.
is supplied with sensory fibres by the autonomic nervous system. Pain with irritation of the visceral peritoneum, like that due to irritation of a viscus, is colicky      and poorly-localized.
pain that comes and goes in waves; generally associated with irritation of abdominal viscera; e.g. menstrual pain, pain due to appendicitis, etc.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
